titlestmt.titleproper: Charlotte C. Stokes artwork for Divers and Snorkelers Guide to the Fishes of the Caribbean 1980-1990
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Charlotte C. Stokes artwork for Divers and Snorkelers Guide to the Fishes of the Caribbean

bioghist.p: Charlotte C. Stokes is an illustrator. Her husband, Joseph F. Stokes, was a member of the board of trustees of the Academy of Natural Sciences and an amateur naturalist and ornithologist. Charlotte Stokes created the images for her husband's book, Divers and Snorkelers Guide to the Fishes and Sea Life of the Caribbean, Florida, Bahamas, and Bermuda, published by the Academy in 1984.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of working sketches and finished illustrations by Stokes for Divers and Snorkelers Guide to the Fishes of the Caribbean. The collection also includes a chart of fish observed by Stokes and her husband (1979-1985), promotional materials, and a map noting areas visited.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
